content.description: Start matched on a jug, move up through the other jugs and top out, optional to continue climbing the arete of the next 'tier' of boulder(s) to the tippy top
content.location: 10ish yards right of Awe at all Angles. SW face

content.description: start standing big ledge matched in the crack/ thumb press, reach out left, work feet, bump left, round the corner with a few hip pops, and make the reach for the jug and finish out 'The Wardrobe'
Start matched on good finger buckets, move up through edges and buckets to a deceiving top out
content.location: 40is yards south of 'The Mystic' just below 'Hip High Mantle'

content.description: Start low on the top edge of boulder boulder, work your way around the bend using the leading edge, move to jugs and work your way to the highest point and top outPowerplant boulder stands roughly 6 tall. (pictures can be deceiving)
Stand start on large shelf, move up and right through an obvious pocket and topout direct or left into the weakness.
Start low on the arete, move up through good crimps and pinches to the high jugs and chill top out-stay on that vertical sliver of rock-
content.location: West facing side of 'Awe at all Angles' / Moon Tooth boulder

content.description: A nice clean line up a beautiful white face.  Start on a big hold about waist height and go straight up using whatever holds you please - you'll likely have to feel around a bit to decipher the good ones from the not-as-good ones.I'm sure that I'm not the first to do this climb -  let me know if you have info about a previous name or FA.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter would be nice since it's medium-tall
content.location: A bit down the hill from Ed Rocks, about 200 feet southwest of Mystic, about 100 feet west of the Powerplant boulder, and about 20 feet west of Baby Tuckoo.

content.description: Start matched low on a side pull, move left to solid finger buckets, hand foot match the start and voilà you're there. Surprisingly good movement for such a small boulder
content.location: Just to your right when when admiring "Awe at all Angles"

content.description: Find the tiny boulder, cringe at the low start, cram yourself under the mineral, match the gritstone edge that will make you reminisce of simpler times when you were highballing at coopers with your crew, find your way back to reality and cringe again at the realization that you're in fact not at coopers and that your lodged under a wet, dirty rock that sees zero climbing traffic, use all that energy you just saved up to, throw the heel up, lift off, cross right,  throw left then bump left again, rearrange your entire life then force yourself over the rock. watch your feet do not dab, climbing police will be after you if you do, $200 fine.
content.location: Down the hill 40ish yards south of 'The Mystic' you cant really see the boulder unless you're below it or at the 'Powerplant' boulder- which is, in fact, lower on the hill

content.description: Start with low underclings and high feet, stand up into the press under the mini roof work your way out misleading edges, find a bomber crimp with the right and chip with the left, bump left to chonky pinch, bump right to a loose rock that "will come loose one day but today is not that day" then right bump again to great edges and you're there-arete is off-
content.location: just left of The Mystic on the SE facing wall

content.description: Sit start on the obvious edge at about waist height, pop up to another edge, and then continue to move up through edges and jugs.  The massive ledge on the left is off.  It's a very straightforward problem with perfect edges that feel like they came right off a campus board, but it's a short problem and the start is somewhat awkward.I'm sure that I'm not the first to do this climb -  let me know if you have info about a previous name or FA.
content.location: A bit down the hill from Ed Rocks, about 200 feet southwest of Mystic, about 100 feet west of the Powerplant boulder, and about 20 feet east of Moocow.

content.description: Start right in the crack left on a bomber crimp, or just in the crack as well, work your way up the crack and top out. the crux is 2/3s of the way through the problem so get your head right if you're a V1 climber.Its too nice of a boulder to not share, I named it after a song that was stuck in my head whilst climbing it. If anyone has a name, or knows who made the FA on it, let me know and ill make changes accordingly!
content.protection: 1-2 pads, might want a spotter as well
content.location: 30ish yards west of 'The Mystic' prominent face of Moon Tooth boulder, proud face, cant miss it

content.description:
An interesting intersection of two rocks creates a great place to boulder. The ground has been cleared and is level making for good landing a good landing zone.  This is an established bouldering area. Please add any routes that you may find here or know about.

The bouldering Pit
